title: unnamable types mentioned in rustc's suggestions

labels.name: A-diagnostics
labels.description: Area: Messages for errors, warnings, and lints

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
Given the following code: https://play.rust-lang.org/?version=stable&mode=debug&edition=2018&gist=94ecf895d0a07d0d72778aa1576eed62

```rust
fn foo() {}

fn bar<T>(t: T) {
    t + foo;
}
```

The current output is:

```
error[E0369]: cannot add `fn() {foo}` to `T`
 --> src/lib.rs:4:7
  |
4 |     t + foo;
  |     - ^ --- fn() {foo}
  |     |
  |     T
  |
help: consider restricting type parameter `T`
  |
3 | fn bar<T: std::ops::Add<Output = fn() {foo}>>(t: T) {
  |         ++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++

For more information about this error, try `rustc --explain E0369`.
```

The compiler suggests code that contains an unnamable type and is therefore invalid. Honestly, I'm not sure what the best remedy for this diagnostic is. In any case, I think this is a relatively low priority issue.
